Package org.mitre.synthea.engine

Interface HealthRecordEditor

All Known Implementing Classes:
GrowthDataErrorsEditor
public interface HealthRecordEditor
The HealthRecordEditor offers an interface that can be implemented to modify a Synthea Person's HealthRecord. At the end of every time step in the simulation, the Synthea framework will invoke the shouldRun method. If the shouldRun function returns true, the framework will then invoke the process method. The process method will be passed any encounters that were created in the past time step.

HealthRecordEditors are intended to simulate actions that happen to an individual's health record. This includes loss or corruption of information through user entry error or information system defects.

HealthRecordEditors SHOULD NOT be used to simulate clinical interactions on the underlying physical state / circumstances of the Synthea Person. Those should be implemented in Synthea modules.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void process​(Person person, java.util.List<HealthRecord.Encounter> encounters, long time)
    Perform the operation on the HealthRecord.Encounter(s).
    boolean shouldRun​(Person person, HealthRecord record, long time)
    Determine whether the editor should be run at the given time step.

  • Method Details

    • shouldRun

      boolean shouldRun​(Person person, HealthRecord record, long time)
      Determine whether the editor should be run at the given time step. This will be invoked for the editor at each time step. It is possible for modules to "skip" steps. So an editor may return false and then return true later. An example of this would be for a editor that only works on adults.
      Parameters:
      person - The Synthea person to check on whether the module should be run
      record - The person's HealthRecord
      time - The current time in the simulation
      Returns:
      True if the editor should be invoked by calling process. False otherwise.

    • process

      void process​(Person person, java.util.List<HealthRecord.Encounter> encounters, long time)
      Perform the operation on the HealthRecord.Encounter(s). HealthRecordEditors do not need to modify the HealthRecord.Encounters(s). HealthRecordModules SHOULD NOT modify the Person. If the person must be modified, then the desired functionality should be implemented as a regular Synthea module.
      Parameters:
      person - The Synthea person that will have their HealthRecord edited
      encounters - The encounters that took place during the last time step of the simulation
      time - The current time in the simulation
